title_sort: walt whitman to harry stafford, 4 september 1883
title: Walt Whitman to Harry Stafford, 4 September 1883
text: CamdenSept:September 4 '831883Dear HarryYours of to-day with the 10 has safely reach'dreached me. Why have you sent it? It is singular & unnecessary—you were entirely welcome, & always have been——I have been away most of the last five or six weeks at Germantown 9 or 10 miles out[side] Phila.Philadelphia on a visit to very kind Quaker folks, particular friends of mine—had a good time—good grub—a horse to my use to drive every day, (which I did, a long drive)—a large library—&c. I am well as usual—nothing very new with my affairs (but the last six or eight months has kind of gone back on me)—I rec'dreceived a letter from Glendale from your mother ab'tabout three weeks ago—I have written two letters to her——I don't know whether this will reach you as I am not certain of the right address—Havn'tHaven't seen Mont for several weeks, but suppose he is here the same yet.W WHarry when you write tell me the exact way to address papers &c. to you through the PO Walt Whitman to Harry Stafford, 4 September 1883
